title: Benson, Illinois
text:
Benson is a village in <a href="Woodford%20County%2C%20Illinois">Woodford County</a>, <a href="Illinois">Illinois</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. The population was 423 at the <a href="United%20States%20Census%202010">2010 census</a>, up from 408 in 2000. It is part of the <a href="Peoria%2C%20Illinois">Peoria, Illinois</a> <a href="Peoria%20metropolitan%20area">Metropolitan Statistical Area</a>.
The village was established in 1874 with the construction of the <a href="Chicago%20and%20St.%20Louis%20Railway">Chicago, Pekin and Southwestern Railroad</a>. The town was named after S.H. Benson of <a href="Streator%2C%20Illinois">Streator, Illinois</a>, the railroad's general freight manager. A post office was established in 1873.
The <a href="Benson%20Water%20Tower">Benson Water Tower</a> was replaced with a modern water tower in the 1980s and has since been demolished.
Geography.
According to the 2010 census, Benson has a total area of , all land.
Demographics.
As of the <a href="census">census</a> of 2000, there were 408 people, 172 households, and 117 families residing in the village. The <a href="population%20density">population density</a> was 2,338.6 people per square mile (926.6/km). There were 183 housing units at an average density of 1,048.9 per square mile (415.6/km). The racial makeup of the village was 99.26% <a href="White%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">White</a>, 0.25% <a href="Asian%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Asian</a>, and 0.49% from two or more races. <a href="Hispanic%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Hispanic</a> or <a href="Latino%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Latino</a> of any race were 0.25% of the population.
There were 172 households, out of which 27.3% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 61.0% were <a href="Marriage">married couples</a> living together, 6.4% had a female householder with no husband present, and 31.4% were non-families. 27.9% of all households were made up of individuals, and 17.4% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.37 and the average family size was 2.92.
In the village, the population was spread out, with 24.3% under the age of 18, 7.4% from 18 to 24, 26.0% from 25 to 44, 16.9% from 45 to 64, and 25.5% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 40 years. For every 100 females, there were 98.1 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 91.9 males.
The median income for a household in the village was $40,500, and the median income for a family was $55,536. Males had a median income of $37,031 versus $21,161 for females. The <a href="per%20capita%20income">per capita income</a> for the village was $19,358. About 5.0% of families and 4.1% of the population were below the <a href="poverty%20line">poverty line</a>, including none of those under age 18 and 9.8% of those age 65 or over.
